revised_title: Stability of Gaseous Lithium Hydroxide and its Relation to Hydroxyl Concentration in Flame Gases
scientific_discipline: Chemistry > Chemical reactions and flame chemistry
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the stability of gaseous lithium hydroxide at high temperatures and its relation to the hydroxyl concentration in flame gases. They found that lithium hydroxide is as stable as predicted and confirmed the existence and importance of the 'hydroxide effect' in flames. This work suggests a simple method to measure the absolute concentration of hydroxyl radicals in flame gases of known temperature.
